definition: to weigh down/to trouble/to implicate (sb)/tied down (by affairs)
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: Children were a tie on her.
sentences.chinese: 小孩對於她是一種牽累。

sentences.english: Tom was up to his ears in that trouble last night.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆昨晚深受那樁麻煩事的牽累。

sentences.english: She says the housework is a tie .
The widow advertised herself as "without encumbrance".
sentences.chinese: 那寡婦登了告白註明“無兒女牽累”。

sentences.english: He was worried by all the cares of the family.
sentences.chinese: 他爲家庭的各種牽累所煩惱。

sentences.english: He had put off all personal cares.
sentences.chinese: 他已擺脫了一切個人的牽累。

sentences.english: I left the room to forestall involvements.
sentences.chinese: 我搶先離開了這房間以免牽累。

sentences.english: At last she was freed from all encumberances.
sentences.chinese: 她終於從一切牽累中解脫出來。

sentences.english: BofA's consumer operations continue to weigh on it.
sentences.chinese: 美銀的消費金融部門至今仍持續牽累整個集團。

sentences.english: The government declared the implicated diplomats persona non grata.
sentences.chinese: 政府宣佈有牽累的外交官爲不受歡迎的人。
